item.title: Goodbye forever WordPress... wait no I didn't mean it, noo
item.description: I’ve been having a lot of maintaining WordPress sites lately. Two different clients of mine have gotten their WordPress websites hacked in the last few months. Because WordPress is by far the most popular CMS right now, it attracts an inordinate amount of attention from hackers. Just last month a site I help maintain, viewpointmag.com suffered incredible amounts of downtime because of what likely was a days-long brute force attack. This is why I’ve decided to move my site from Wordpress to Hugo, a static site generator that creates websites which are lot less prone to hacking attempts.

item.title: Kickstarter Videos and Design for Artana Games
item.description: Powering Up! is an expansion to the hit board game Tesla vs. Edison. Funded over 3000%, Powering Up! raised 3/4ths the money of its base game, Tesla vs. Edison.

item.title: Article Design and Illustration for Involution Studios
item.description: Disrupt! is Involution Studio’s Summer 2015 feature article which explores the historical evolution of technology and UX, and posits that we’re in the midst of a third Industrial Revolution.

item.title: Case Study Video for Involution Studios
item.description: DataXu had a unique vision to be a leader in the big data game. Thanks to the Involution Studios redesign that data now gives their clients many recommendations and methods to forecast, in real time, anytime.

item.title: Digital and Print Design for Involution Studios
item.description: Involution Studios, a UX design agency working in the healthcare space, was founded in 2004 in Palo Alto, CA. I worked with Involution for two years creating marketing assets.

item.title: Book Trailers
item.description: Authors Jon Follett and Matthew Holm contacted me to create a trailer for their latest book. The project time frame was short–the book release was only two weeks away.

item.title: Digital Design for Artana
item.description: Artana is a boardgame company founded in 2011. I’ve worked for two years as Artana’s marketing graphic designer, eCommerce website administrator, video production and motion graphics guy, and on occasion, copywriter.

item.title: Documentary for The Ohio Center for Extra-scientific Research
item.description: The Ohio Center for Extrascientific Research or The OCER is a fictional organization inspired by reality TV shows like Ghosthunters and River Monsters and alternative media like Coast to Coast AM and Infowars.

item.title: Interactive Infographic for MLA Companies
item.description: MLA Companies was in the midst of a website redesign, and requested I give their “VIP process” document a facelift to match the look of their new site.

item.title: Music Video for Fine Animal
item.description: Observe Arts was a video production project started by myself and designer Owen Carstensen. Observe created projections for Columbus-based band Fine Animal’s album release show and documented their performance.

item.title: Presentation Design for Dirk Knemeyer
item.description: While working with social futurist Dirk Knemeyer, I had the opportunity to design several of his presentations.

item.title: Promotional Video for Artana
item.description: A game system that’s epic in scope, The Chronicles Series is five interconnected board games that span the history of Western Civilization.

item.title: TotalGrow Product Video for Venntis Technologies
item.description: TotalGrow lighting uses a new LED technology which only emits light at the wavelengths most advantageous for plant growth.

item.title: Website for The Xavier Lab
item.description: The Xavier Lab at Massachusetts General Hospital and the Broad Institute needed to refresh their web presence. They had the content, their problem was its presentation. Their website was information rich, but ugly and difficult to keep updated.

item.title: About
item.description: Brian is a designer and visual artist with a background in graphic design, film and art history. He specializes in time-based media design and strives to create beautiful things in every medium available to him. Brian is a graduate of Columbus College of Art & Design.
